The mentoring component grew out of him becoming bored and frustrated just sitting at the Idol desk and picking apart performances, Simon Cowell said. I wanted to make a show on which I and my fellow judges could help on a weekly basis. It's interesting to be judged as much as the artists. It really does become incredibly competitive. Unlike the singers, we don't pretend to like each other. Simon Cowell avoided commenting extensively on the new "Idol" judges panel, saying he hasn't seen a whole episode. Granted, the audition rounds are always rough at first, and Jackson, Steven Tyler , and Jennifer Lopez are still getting used to working together, but I couldn't help but to notice how much the show's standards are lowered with Simon Cowell out of the picture.
